channel.title: Portforwarding Guide - Linksys {Easy}
channel.description:
[center][size=14pt][u][b]This Tutorial Will hopefully teach you how to portforward a linksys router[/b][/u][/size]
First open a command prompt
[img]http://i614.photobucket.com/albums/tt230/bmaw/Untitled-10.jpg[/img]
Type in "ipconfig" and hit enter
Write Down your I Pv4 Address
[img]http://i614.photobucket.com/albums/tt230/bmaw/Untitled1.jpg[/img]
Then open up an internet page and type 192.168.1.1 (If that doesn't work go to www.ipchicken.com and use that)
It may ask you for a user and pass. Mine is admin and admin but it could be admin and password.
Or your parents may have set a different one.
[img]http://i614.photobucket.com/albums/tt230/bmaw/2-1.jpg[/img]
You should get a page like that.
Click Applications & Gaming then Port Range Forward.
[img]http://i614.photobucket.com/albums/tt230/bmaw/3-1.jpg[/img]
Fill it out like this then save settings.
The ip is what you wrote down for your I Pv4
[img]http://i614.photobucket.com/albums/tt230/bmaw/4-2.jpg[/img]
After you do that people will be able to log on using your ip.
To use something like server.no-ip.org...
Go to www.no-ip.com and register an account.
After you register go to Add A host.
[img]http://i614.photobucket.com/albums/tt230/bmaw/Untitled-8.jpg[/img]
Fill it out like this and click Create host.
[img]http://i614.photobucket.com/albums/tt230/bmaw/Untitled-9.jpg[/img]
:) There you have it.
Feel Free To ask if you have any questions
~Bmaw[/center]

item.title: Portforwarding Guide - Linksys {Easy}
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“Bmaw, post:1, topic:287274”][center][size=14pt]This Tutorial Will hopefully teach you how to portforward a linksys router[/size]

First open a command prompt

Type in “ipconfig” and hit enter

Write Down your I Pv4 Address

Then open up an internet page and type 192.168.1.1 (If that doesn’t work go to www.ipchicken.com and use that)

It may ask you for a user and pass. Mine is admin and admin but it could be admin and password.

Or your parents may have set a different one.

You should get a page like that.

Click Applications & Gaming then Port Range Forward.

Fill it out like this then save settings.

The ip is what you wrote down for your I Pv4

After you do that people will be able to log on using your ip.

To use something like server.no-ip.org…

Go to www.no-ip.com and register an account.

After you register go to Add A host.

Fill it out like this and click Create host.

There you have it.

Feel Free To ask if you have any questions

~Bmaw[/center][/quote]

If you knew much about port-forwarding or setting up your own applications (hosted from your computer,) you should know that No-IP isn’t needed in the connection. It’s a nice guide, however, No-IP isn’t needed, nor is it part of the port-forwarding process.

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding Guide - Linksys {Easy}
item.dc:creator: @Cody-Xo Cody-Xo
item.description:
@Cody-Xo wrote:

Note: Some people don’t have an I PvM4 address, I didn’t. “Default Gateway” is the same thing though, and can replace the I PvM4.

Also: If you don’t know the password to your router (for those of you who have a password set, or your parents set one, it is required to know it to make this guide work) there’s a “reset” button on the back of every LinkSkys router. I’d recommend google’ing your version of the router if you can’t find the button. All you have to do is hold down the button for 30 seconds, restart your internet, and then go type in your default gateway/pvm4 address again, and for the password and username use “Admin” (Yes, for both.)

By holding down the reset button it puts your router back to default settings, so it’s admin password and admin username.

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding Guide - Linksys {Easy}
item.dc:creator: @0wn4g3sc4p3 0wn4g3sc4p3
item.description:
@0wn4g3sc4p3 wrote:

Ok, I’m trying to run my server on a laptop, brand new, nothing on it. It’s got pretty good specs, So I’d like to run my server on it until I can pay for a VPS.

I’m having a little trouble allowing others to connect to my server. I have linksys, and I’ve portforwarded already. I’ve created a no-ip, and i’ve allowed my servers port access through my firewall. (windows 7, extremely complicated… for me anyway.) I can connect to my server on my own computer, using my no-ip adress, but my brother, or anyone else can’t from other computers. They just get error connecting to server. But I log in fine, and it saves my characters file and all. We’ve tried everything we could think of, and nothing is working… I’d appreciate some help.

my email is dbiggdogg92@ymail.com, thanks.

Read full topic
